name: users.list
desc: Lists all users in a Slack team.

cursor.desc: Paginate through collections of data by setting the `cursor` parameter to a `next_cursor` attribute returned by a previous request's `response_metadata`. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See [pagination](/apis/web-api/pagination) for more detail.

include_locale.desc: Set this to `true` to receive the locale for users. Defaults to `false`.

limit.desc: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached. Providing no `limit` value will result in Slack attempting to deliver you the entire result set. If the collection is too large you may experience `limit_required` or HTTP 500 errors.

team_id.desc: encoded team id to list users in, required if org token is used.

examples:
{
    "ok": true,
    "members": [
        {
            "id": "W012A3CDE",
            "team_id": "T012AB3C4",
            "name": "spengler",
            "deleted": false,

errors.invalid_cursor: Value passed for `cursor` was not valid or is no longer valid.
errors.limit_required: For large teams a limit is required.
